title: Metacognitive Support Instructional Design for Online Unstructured Mathematical Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary mathematical concepts and basic problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: A course conducted in a smartphone-based microlearning environment for in-service secondary school teachers, emphasizing unstructured mathematical problem-solving activities reflecting real classroom scenarios.

learning_goals: Learners can suggest at least three problem-representation strategies using metacognition in unstructured mathematical problem situations
Learners can establish systematic procedures to monitor and evaluate problem-solving processes in online environments
Learners can maintain social presence at over 80% during collaborative problem-solving with peers using reflective scaffolding

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
